alert.note: Alert for Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 9:00AM CDT until July 19 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Henry County in Tennessee... Weakley County in Tennessee... * Until noon CDT. * At 900 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Martin, Paris, McKenzie, Dresden, Greenfield, Gleason, Sharon, Cottage Grove, Palmersville, Routon, Latham, Puryear, Henry, Como, Ore Springs, Matheny Grove, Osage, Jones Mill, Sandhill and Brundige. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
